entries.title: New bill will force Twitter, TikTok and other social media platforms to increase transparency by sharing internal data
entries.description: Senators introduced a bill targeting the lack of transparency among social media companies even as lawmakers consider banning some platforms in the U.S.

entries.title: Semiconductor maker Micron announces 10% staff reduction, suspends bonuses
entries.description: Micron said that it would hit its reduction target through voluntary departures as well as layoffs.

entries.title: Under Armour picks Marriott exec Stephanie Linnartz to be new CEO after seven-month search
entries.description: Under Armour ended its seven-month search for a new CEO by announcing that it had hired Marriott executive Stephanie Linnartz to take the job.

entries.title: H&M removes Justin Bieber merchandise following criticism from pop star
entries.description: H&M will no longer sell a line of Justin Bieber merchandise after the musician told fans he didn't "approve" of the clothing bearing his name and likeness.

entries.title: Zelenskyy to meet with Biden, address U.S. Congress on his first known wartime trip outside Ukraine
entries.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will meet with President Joe Biden at the White House and then address a joint session of Congress in the evening.

entries.title: I drove hundreds of miles 'hands-free' in GM, Ford and Tesla cars – here's how it went
entries.description: CNBC's Michael Wayland recently tested "hands-free" systems from Tesla, GM and Ford. Theirs are among the most readily available and dynamic on the market.

entries.title: Cryptocurrencies could cause the next financial crisis, Indian central bank head warns
entries.description: Shaktikanta Das, governor of the Reserve Bank of India, said his main concern is that cryptocurrencies do not have any underlying value.

entries.title: Investors should look to 'good quality corporate debt and gold' in 2023, strategist says
entries.description: Corporate debt and gold could be strong options for investors in 2023, according to Michael Howell, managing director at CrossBorder Capital.

entries.title: Treasury yields muted as calm returns to bond markets after sell-off
entries.description: U.S. Treasury yields were muted as global bond markets stabilized after the previous session's sell-off on the back of Bank of Japan's surprise policy shift.

entries.title: Goldman Sachs says the Bank of Japan may start tightening, but others disagree
entries.description: The BOJ's monetary meeting concluded Tuesday with no change to its current ultra-low interest rate at -0.1%, a stance it's held since 2016.

entries.title: Investments are set to flow back into China as tech giants avoid U.S. delisting, government pledges policy support, says investment manager
entries.description: As Chinese tech companies avoid U.S. delisting risk, investment dollars could flow back into these names, says investment manager KraneShares.

entries.title: Read how much Trump paid — or didn't pay — in taxes each year
entries.description: Donald Trump has guarded his income tax returns from public disclosure. A House committee has voted to release them in redacted form.

entries.title: Bitcoin miner Core Scientific is filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy — but plans to keep mining
entries.description: Core Scientific, one of the largest publicly traded crypto mining companies in the U.S., is filing for bankruptcy protection.

entries.title: Jim Cramer says these 7 stocks will be winners in 2023
entries.description: Cramer said many of Wall Street's concerns about the market are overblown.

entries.title: Only one Trump tax return as president got mandatory IRS audit, report says
entries.description: A report on Donald Trump's federal income taxes was released after a House panel voted to make public redacted copies of his tax returns.

entries.title: Dan Yergin says oil prices could hit $121 a barrel when China fully reopens
entries.description: S&P Global's base case forecast for oil prices is $90 a barrel for 2023, but Dan Yergin warns there are major uncertainties looming over markets.

entries.title: Elon Musk tries to explain why Tesla shares are tanking
entries.description: As Tesla shares sank 8% on Tuesday, reaching a new 52-week low, CEO Elon Musk tried to blame macroeconomic factors.
